hero.title: Why Good Mind Society exists
hero.subtitle: We started with a simple observation: people thrive when learning is respectful, consistent, and community-led.

origin.title: Origin story
origin.body: Good Mind Society began as a volunteer study group that kept growing. We saw that access was not the only barrier; structure and encouragement mattered just as much. We now build pathways that make learning feel possible again.

dignity.title: Dignity first
dignity.body: We prioritize agency, respect, and the lived wisdom of learners.

evidence.title: Evidence-minded compassion
evidence.body: We blend empathy with data, testing ideas and learning openly.

growth.title: Long-term growth
growth.body: We invest in habits, mentors, and community structures that endure.

cohort1.title: Cohort 01 completed its first cycle
cohort1.excerpt: Learners finished eight weeks of guided practice with a 92% attendance rate.
cohort1.body: Our first Linkers cohort completed eight weeks of guided study. Mentors report stronger confidence, and learners are now preparing for the next phase.

partner.title: Two new community partners onboarded
partner.excerpt: Local organizations in Seoul and Busan are preparing their first cohorts.
partner.body: We welcomed two partners who will host Learning Circles starting next quarter. Their teams are aligning schedules, recruitment, and support roles.

mentor.title: Mentor training refreshed for 2026
mentor.excerpt: The updated playbook adds trauma-informed facilitation and goal tracking.
mentor.body: Our mentor orientation now includes new modules on psychological safety, accountability check-ins, and peer learning techniques.

impact.title: Baseline impact survey underway
impact.excerpt: We are collecting early feedback to refine our evaluation approach.
impact.body: Learners and mentors are sharing baseline reflections so we can measure changes in confidence and skills over time.
